newsitem.title: FRENCH GUIANA: Police and demonstrators clash in French Guiana.
newsitem.headline: Police and demonstrators clash in French Guiana.

text.p: Police and demonstrators clashed early on Friday after striking students blocked the main government building in the French territory of French Guiana, witnesses said.
Several hundred high school student demonstrators were dispersed by police who fired teargas in the capital city of Cayenne on the northeast coast of South America.

The demonstrators, who were protesting against poor school conditions, had erected make-shift barricades, thrown rocks and burned tires for several hours on Thursday night. They dispersed after police fired several teargas canisters.
Several cars were damaged but there were no reports of injuries, witnesses said.
